title: ChessVibes Chess Magazine
description:
ChessVibes Chess Magazine - Here is Chess Vibes Openings PDF 0-156 with index and ChessVibes Training 1-135 - ALL ISSUES as from November it's merged with chess.com

Which openings are hot in top level chess? Which are not? Receive the latest opening novelties right in your mailbox with ChessVibes Openings, a weekly PDF magazine (+ PGN!) covering the latest openings news, co-authored by International Masters Merijn van Delft and Robert Ris and published by ChessVibes.
What is ChessVibes Openings?

Every issue consists of a PDF Magazine and the accompanying PGN file. The PDF consists of four pages (A4 size) with the following contents:

WhatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s hot? A round-up of this weekÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s important opening developments, with statistics about the frequence and score of the weekÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s most important opening novelty (page 1)
WhatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not? Which openings are not recommended at the moment, according to the top players? And why not? (page 1)
Game of the week Each week youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll find the theoretically most important game analysed by our two IMs, with a detailed survey of the opening phase (page 2).
This weekÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s harvest Four more new important opening ideas from this week (page 3) revealed and described with explanation of the opening and early middlegame (page 3).
ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Your Move An interactive element: every week two exercises, of which the solutions/explanations will follow one week later. This will improve your understanding of certain opening, middlegame or even endgame themes even further.
